Tool vibes

Feelings of attachment one may have to a particular tool, physical or digital, in that this tool invokes a longing for a particular way of getting things done. Adjacent to the Portuguese ‚Äúsaudade‚Äù.

Contextualized

I‚Äôm aware that the following terms may (somewhat) describe this concept:

  • FOMO: fear of missing out on a particular experience, often invoked by social media imagery and other content of people engaging in this experience
  • Chain of supply and demand
  • Analysis paralysis
  • Early adopter complex

Cause Discomfort of emotions

I‚Äôve found that tool vibes are a very particular longing, one that is caused by the omnipresence of the objects that these tools help us access: our experience of time, our list of tasks, our goals, our vision.

Characteristics

  • Longing
  • Visually heavy
  • Problem solving is led by tool availability: I‚Äôve transformed my own problem by jumping to a tool even if it didn‚Äôt entirely match, just to experience the relief of having solved my problem
